Clinton cited analyses by the macroecono: s Analytics to support her claim that her plans would be better for jobs.
Moody: s Analytics forecasted a dire economic projection if Trump were able to implement all of his proposed policies, including an extended recession and 3.4 million job losses over the course of his presidency.
However: Moody's Analytics also acknowledged that it is unlikely that Clinton would be able to pass all of her proposals through a divided Congress, which could result in fewer jobs being created.
